dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1285 IH: Immigration Authorization Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Donalds introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To require a report from the Secretary of Homeland Security on the existence of programs and components of the Department of Homeland Security that are not explicitly authorized in statute.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Immigration Authorization Act of 2023.

section.header: Report on unauthorized programs and components

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days, the Secretary of Homeland Security shall submit a report, to the relevant committees, that identifies each program carried out by the Secretary under the immigration laws (as such term is defined in section 101 of the Immigration and Nationality Act) and each component of the Department of Homeland Security that carries out any duty under the immigration laws if that program or component is not explicitly authorized to be carried out for fiscal year 2024 by a statutory provision.
For purposes of this section, the term relevant commmittees meansâ€”

paragraph.text: the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives;
the Subcommittee on Homeland Security of the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate;
the Committee on the Judiciary of the Senate; and
the Subcommittee on Homeland Security of the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate.
